goal.summary: Your goal is to maximise the score in 2050. Your score is calculated as the weighted average of the economic, social, and environmental scores, which can be seen below.
goal.title: Goal

2019.intro: In this game, you will be assigned a point of view - expressed as a mix between economic, environmental and social preferences. Your mission is simple: maximize the score for that viewpoint by making climate policy choices in 2020, 2030, and 2040. In 2050, your solution is compared to the optimal score calculated by the Open Source Energy Modelling System for Europe (OSeMBE).

2020.researchDecision: Should there be extra financial incentives for research and development of renewable/carbon free technologies?
2020.emissionsDecision: Which restrictions are you willing to set in order to reach your emission target?

2030.transmissionDecision: 'Do you want to implement the 10-year network development plan on transboundary grid capacity?

2050.intro: Below, you can see your total score.

options.lowReduction: Low reduction rate – EU ETS cap
options.mediumReduction: Medium reduction rate - IPPC Pathway Zero Emissions in 2050
options.highReduction: High reduction rate - Zero emissions in 2040

decisions.whichChoices: In order to maximize your score in 2050, you are now asked for some climate policy choices. Remember that you need to take your assigned point of view into account when making your choices.
decisions.keepEmission: Do you want to keep your emission reduction rate for the next 10 years or change it?

euAcknowledgement: This project has received funding from the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 691739.
